transformed_texts:
The Catholic Church needs to change some of its views.
This is because the church is losing followers.
Many people do not agree with the church's strong opinions on gay marriage, abortion, and birth control.
The church has old-fashioned views on these subjects.
If the church changed to newer thinking, it might not lose followers.
Some people are turning against the church because of its views on these subjects.
They do not agree with the church on these issues.
The church is against abortion, so people who support it might not feel comfortable.
The church is also against gay marriage.
People who believe in it might not want to follow the church.
I do not see any reason why female priests are not allowed or why priests cannot be married.
But I do not know if this would have prevented the loss of followers.
The church might not have done things differently if priests could be married.
It is hard to know for sure.
I do not see why priests cannot have a family life, too.
The church says priests are married to God, but everyone else has a family life and other commitments.

Me, I am not against gay marriage. It does not matter if people are born this way or not. I think people should not be blamed for their sexual orientation. It is not something they choose. Some people say a man and a woman can marry, but not two people of the same sex. This is wrong. I do not think the federal government should decide this. It is not a legal or moral issue. It is not safe for our country. It is not right to judge people just because of their birth. They should not be punished.

I think that gay marriage should be legalized. There is not a good reason not to. Many people believe that homosexual couples threaten the traditional family, but it is different. There are many reasons why it should be legal. In some places, gay couples cannot visit their partners in the hospital or stay together in the same home. This is not fair. Many studies show that gay couples have the same kind of relationships as straight couples. They want a marriage certificate, not a church wedding. If religions do not want to perform the ceremony, that is their choice. They should not prevent the government from giving a marriage certificate because it is a legal document, not a religious one. Gay couples can adopt children and be good parents, just like straight couples. The community will not be harmed by them. The federal government should make it legal in every state. It is unfair to ban gay marriage if the government cannot even agree on issues like prayer in schools. Many people think that gay people are damaged or traumatized, but this is not true. Scientists have studied this and found that it is not correct. People should listen to scientists instead of just their friends and neighbors.

I work in a hospital pharmacy this summer. I say no to having illegal drugs available to the public. But for medical use, I say yes. Illegal drugs can be good because some are used in medicines.

For example, oxycotton, Vicodin, and Percocets are controlled substances, but we use them. We should not deny their benefits just because they are taboo. We should embrace their benefits.

Marijuana is different from alcohol. Abusing either can cause bad things, but marijuana is not as bad as heroine or cocaine. People have a bad image of marijuana because it's an illegal drug. If we remove this bad image, people might use it responsibly for medical purposes.

I think we should make marijuana legal gradually, not all at once. This way, people can use it responsibly. It is not a simple issue.

I think the church has changed to be more modern.
Before, it was stricter. When I was young, I went to church every Sunday. I wore a cute dress, matching shoes, and a purse. Now, the church has a teenager mass that is short, thirty minutes. People wear more casual clothes, even at morning masses. I think other changes include family arriving late and dressing casually.
 Concerning the accusations against Catholic priests, I do not think the church could have prevented the abuse. Some men become pedophiles even if they are married. It is not because they are allowed or not allowed to get married. In other religions, like Seventh Heaven, men can get married, but I think those who want to practice their faith and be married should choose a different faith. I think pedophilia is often genetic, not something people are brought up to be. The church might not have known about all cases, but if they did and covered it up, they should be ashamed.

I was fine with the idea but many people were still upset about the September 11 attacks.
The Bush administration said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction and was connected to Osama Bin Laden. This was not true.
I think the Bush administration lied to the American people. Colin Powell, who was Secretary of State, said later he was not sure about the evidence he presented at the UN.
I think this is a problem. The Bush administration did not follow the constitution and tried to change it. They wanted to go to war because of their feelings about Saddam Hussein and to get more energy.
The war has lasted too long. But if we leave now, Iraq could have a civil war. The UN and US want to get help from nearby countries like Syria and Saudi Arabia. But this could cause more problems because Iraq's sovereignty will be an issue. The government is weak, and there are many different groups fighting for control.

I talk about the war in Iraq.
It is not a real war because it was not declared by Congress.
I do not like the war.
It was not a big reason to bomb Iraq.
I think the United States did it to get back at Iraq for the attacks on September 11.
I do not follow the news about the war.
I think we stay in Iraq to build democracy and get oil.
But it is not a good reason.
Democracy cannot be built in one day.
If we leave, it takes time for Iraq to start again.
It is difficult to decide if the war should continue.
I think the war should not be called a war.
It is for showing we are big and American.
I think it is not very important to stay in Iraq.
It is important to help Iraq, but it is also a waste of resources.
I feel bad for President Bush.
The war makes him look bad.
The Vietnam War was like this.
It was not declared by Congress.
It is called a meaningless war.
Bush will be called a bad president because of the war.
There are many families with sons and daughters in Iraq.
I want the war to stay because of them.
But they have a different culture than us.
If we stay, it makes the situation worse.
Al-Qaeda will grow more.
Their hatred for the U.S. will grow.
It will hurt us in the end to keep staying there.
The war will go on for a long time.

I do not feel it is right to make it legal or for a state to declare it legal. The constitution says church and state should be separate. Trying to change that would be wrong. It would be like one church's beliefs over another. Most Catholics and Christians are against it. I think the government should not decide what churches can or cannot make illegal. Separation of church and state is important for religious tolerance in the United States. Making an amendment about it would be against the constitution. It would restrict people, not the government. The federal government should not be involved in this issue. The president's push for an amendment is just his personal belief as a Catholic. I think the churches should decide this. There is no good reason for an amendment. It might even help society.

The war in Iraq was a big mistake. The government did not tell the truth about the reasons for going to war. They said it was to stop terrorism, but it was really to take over Iraq. In 2003, the war started. Many people did not agree with the war, including me. I think it was like the Vietnam War. The government should have learned from that. Many soldiers died, and the government was not ready for what happened after. They took away Iraq's government and tried to put a new one in place, but it was very hard. Many people were against this. The war is still going on in 2006. Many soldiers are still dying. The government should have planned better. It was not an easy thing to do. I hope the war ends soon, but it probably won't.

I think I am for gay marriage. I always have been. I think it is a personal choice, and it is not something that should take away rights from anyone, because it is not under their control. I think it is not fair. I always have been an advocate for gay marriage.

I do not think politics or government should be involved in this. It is not a state issue. It is a personal issue. It is a household issue. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live like any other family. They walk the dogs and live like everyone else.

I think it is not right for President Bush to decide what marriage should be. I think it is silly.

I have heard and read that some people believe being gay is a chemical thing in the brain, something that you might be born with. This is different from growing up in a certain way.

I think marriage should be a private matter. If a man and woman want to get married, they can do it without anyone knowing. But if two gay people get married, it becomes public.

I do not think government should be involved in marriage. Marriage should be a personal decision.

When you put something on the internet, it is public. Everyone can see it. You cannot control this. It is good to remember this. As a Resident Assistant, I have dealt with this already. You put something out there, and it can affect people's opinions of you. If you talk about bad things, someone could say something. The internet is seen by everyone. If you are friends with someone on Myspace, you get their bulletins. Obviously, the school did not get the bulletin first. Someone went to the school. They had to act. They cannot let it sit, just in case something happens. They must prevent it. But sometimes, people only fool around. They do not mean what they say. In our school, something happened. Some people overheard something and called it in. When the school found out who the person was, they looked through his Facebook. They got worried because there were bad things there. He may have meant it as a joke. But now, it was serious. When you put stuff on the internet, there is no privacy. If you do not want it out there, you should not put it there. You cannot tell people what to think. You cannot tell them what to take seriously. School officials should not friend students on Myspace or Facebook. They should not stalk students' accounts. But if someone brings something to the school officials, there is no invasion of privacy. They must take it seriously. Teachers should not make accounts and friend students. This is not good. It is the same as stalking students. I should not friend my residents because I do not want to know what they do. I do not want to see pictures of them drinking. Then I have to do something about it. It is not my place. I do not want that connection.

The war has lasted too long. The original purpose was good – to bring democracy to a country without a fair political system. But now, the motivation seems unclear. We are not winning. We are not getting the results we want. We should stop the war and bring our soldiers home. We should use our money to help our own people, not fight a long and uncertain war. It is time to stop and think about what we are doing.

I want to ask a question.
Someone found information online about a situation and it prevented a bad thing from happening.
Is it okay for people to look at others' profiles on MySpace?
If you post information on the internet, other people can see it.
It's like giving permission to see your profile.
But it's not okay to have someone's job be to look at people's profiles.
It depends on the situation.
If someone finds evidence of bad things, it's okay.
But if someone just looks at profiles randomly, it's not okay.
I don't have MySpace, but I have Facebook.
I worry about creepy people seeing my information.
I've seen a TV show where a man got a girl's name and talked to her in a minute.
I have friends who IM me on Facebook.
I don't know them in real life.
They know my interests, photos, and class schedule.
It's hard because I want to communicate with friends.
I only accept people I know on Facebook.
But I don't know who can see my profile.

I feel bad talking about this. I feel like I'm joining others who say they were against the Iraq War from the start. But it's not important now. Most people think it was a bad idea. Eighty percent of Iraqis and U.S. troops think we should leave. It's been a disaster since we started. The administration doesn't want to admit they were wrong. I don't see a reason to stay. I don't understand why we should stay. It's hard to understand why the administration thinks we should stay. The culture and politics are very different in the Middle East. Saddam was a bad leader, but we didn't consider the consequences before we invaded. We should leave now. Iraqis want us to leave. It's better to leave now. We can't be the good guys in the Middle East. Staying is worse than leaving now.

I think there is still some gender discrimination in the United States. Both men and women experience this.
For example, it can be hard for a woman to get a high position in a company because of the "glass ceiling." People may think women are not as good as men.
Also, men who stay at home to take care of children often face problems. People might think it's not right for a man to do this. They might think he should be the main worker.
In the fashion industry, men might not be taken seriously because they are seen as not knowing about fashion for women.
This happens in other industries too. For example, a person from a farm might not get a good job if they don't speak or write well. Other people might think they are not really intelligent.
I think change is slow and we need to work at the right pace. People should not force the idea of equality. Instead, they can show good examples.
We should also be careful about judging others based on where they come from. This can cause discrimination.

I learned that they changed marijuana to a less serious crime. This made it like a traffic ticket, not a serious punishment. If someone gets a ticket, it does not hurt their job chances as much as a drug charge. But, the problem is that the worst effects can still happen. Many people worry about this. It also costs a lot to arrest and punish people who use it. This is why some cities do not change their laws. However, in places like Denver, where people are more open to new ideas, they did change the law. They now have more money for schools, social programs, and food for homeless people. It is important to legalize marijuana because it will save money and help people. But it should not be everywhere, because it is still against the law in many places. People may feel embarrassed if it is shown in public. I think alcohol has worse effects on driving skills. But marijuana can also affect people's lives. Everyone reacts differently to substances. So it is hard to make rules for everyone.

I say yes.
Many things they do are traditional.
Good to be rooted in tradition.
But also need to be adaptable to change.
Many Catholics go to church every week.
They follow rules closely.
Sometimes, they look down on others who don't follow perfectly.
They don't accept people of other religions.
My parents were an Episcopalian and a Catholic.
They wouldn't marry in the Catholic church.
This is not being tolerant of other religions.
They teach to love others, but don't accept them.
This is hypocritical.
Catholic teaching says to do things, but practice is outdated.
They continue to follow it.
I think priests should be allowed to marry.
But this would not stop pedophilic behavior.
It's a different situation.
I think it would not be an issue.
Pedophiles would act the same, with or without a spouse.
Allowing priests to marry would not prevent these things.
These problems would still happen.

I don't know.
I am not sure what to think.
This topic is very difficult.
It is so close to the issue of church and state.
And how to define marriage is hard to do without upsetting anyone.

So, I don't know.
Maybe all civil unions should be treated the same.
Maybe the government should not look at them in a special way because they are sacraments.
If two people get married, they should just get a civil union.
That's what it is.

If all states agree, then they should make it a federal law.
But changing the constitution to ban gay marriage is silly.
It is not big enough to change the constitution.
It is not important enough to amend the constitution.

No, I don't think the constitution should be changed for this.

I grew up in a Christian home.
I think of homosexuality as a difficult issue.
I have many gay friends.
I do not agree with their lifestyle.
But, I think it should be legal.
I do not think it should be a national issue.
I think each state should decide.
Many states are democratic.
Many states are republican.
Democratic states will support gay marriage.
If you live in a democratic state, you know its position.
I think you should not disagree if a state legalizes gay marriage.
I think homosexuals should have the same opportunities as others.
I think it should be legal based on each state's decision.
I do not think President Bush should decide for the whole country.
I think it should be up to the states.
I do not agree with his ban.
I think each state should decide how to run itself.
He will be out of office soon.
If a new president decides to lift the ban, it will change back and forth.
It should be up to each state.
They will live with the decision, not the president.

I think that students should not be worried about posting on Myspace. Myspace is public. That means everyone can see what you post. Even school officials can look at what students post. This is because students might say or do something that could be harmful to others. School officials should check online to find out if students are doing bad things. This helps keep students safe. However, it is not okay for school officials to look on the internet just to catch students. The internet should only be used to make the school safer. If school officials find something dangerous, they should stop it. This is their job. It is important to be safe in school.

War
First, I was very angry. I was affected by 9/11. I wanted to fight back. But now I am not so sure.

We went to war to fight the people who did this. But maybe we did not think enough about what might happen.

We did not have a good plan. We were not ready. We did not know what to expect.

I think it was too emotional. We were not thinking clearly. We wanted revenge. President Bush wanted to go to war. Everyone was angry.

But we could have done things better. We did not have a good plan. We did not know what to do.

We should have not gone in. They were fighting each other. They did not want us there.

We are not making enough progress. We are not helping them. They will fight again after we leave. We should leave.

The Catholic Church needs to change some of its views.
This is because the church is losing followers.
Many people do not agree with the church's strong opinions on gay marriage, abortion, and birth control.
The church has old-fashioned views on these subjects.
If the church changed to newer thinking, it might not lose followers.
Some people are turning against the church because of its views on these subjects.
They do not agree with the church on these issues.
The church is against abortion, so people who support it might not feel comfortable.
The church is also against gay marriage.
People who believe in it might not want to follow the church.
I do not see any reason why female priests are not allowed or why priests cannot be married.
But I do not know if this would have prevented the loss of followers.
The church might not have done things differently if priests could be married.
It is hard to know for sure.
I do not see why priests cannot have a family life, too.
The church says priests are married to God, but everyone else has a family life and other commitments.

Me, I am not against gay marriage. It does not matter if people are born this way or not. I think people should not be blamed for their sexual orientation. It is not something they choose. Some people say a man and a woman can marry, but not two people of the same sex. This is wrong. I do not think the federal government should decide this. It is not a legal or moral issue. It is not safe for our country. It is not right to judge people just because of their birth. They should not be punished.

I think that gay marriage should be legalized. There is not a good reason not to. Many people believe that homosexual couples threaten the traditional family, but it is different. There are many reasons why it should be legal. In some places, gay couples cannot visit their partners in the hospital or stay together in the same home. This is not fair. Many studies show that gay couples have the same kind of relationships as straight couples. They want a marriage certificate, not a church wedding. If religions do not want to perform the ceremony, that is their choice. They should not prevent the government from giving a marriage certificate because it is a legal document, not a religious one. Gay couples can adopt children and be good parents, just like straight couples. The community will not be harmed by them. The federal government should make it legal in every state. It is unfair to ban gay marriage if the government cannot even agree on issues like prayer in schools. Many people think that gay people are damaged or traumatized, but this is not true. Scientists have studied this and found that it is not correct. People should listen to scientists instead of just their friends and neighbors.

I work in a hospital pharmacy this summer. I say no to having illegal drugs available to the public. But for medical use, I say yes. Illegal drugs can be good because some are used in medicines.

For example, oxycotton, Vicodin, and Percocets are controlled substances, but we use them. We should not deny their benefits just because they are taboo. We should embrace their benefits.

Marijuana is different from alcohol. Abusing either can cause bad things, but marijuana is not as bad as heroine or cocaine. People have a bad image of marijuana because it's an illegal drug. If we remove this bad image, people might use it responsibly for medical purposes.

I think we should make marijuana legal gradually, not all at once. This way, people can use it responsibly. It is not a simple issue.

I think the church has changed to be more modern.
Before, it was stricter. When I was young, I went to church every Sunday. I wore a cute dress, matching shoes, and a purse. Now, the church has a teenager mass that is short, thirty minutes. People wear more casual clothes, even at morning masses. I think other changes include family arriving late and dressing casually.
 Concerning the accusations against Catholic priests, I do not think the church could have prevented the abuse. Some men become pedophiles even if they are married. It is not because they are allowed or not allowed to get married. In other religions, like Seventh Heaven, men can get married, but I think those who want to practice their faith and be married should choose a different faith. I think pedophilia is often genetic, not something people are brought up to be. The church might not have known about all cases, but if they did and covered it up, they should be ashamed.

I was fine with the idea but many people were still upset about the September 11 attacks.
The Bush administration said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction and was connected to Osama Bin Laden. This was not true.
I think the Bush administration lied to the American people. Colin Powell, who was Secretary of State, said later he was not sure about the evidence he presented at the UN.
I think this is a problem. The Bush administration did not follow the constitution and tried to change it. They wanted to go to war because of their feelings about Saddam Hussein and to get more energy.
The war has lasted too long. But if we leave now, Iraq could have a civil war. The UN and US want to get help from nearby countries like Syria and Saudi Arabia. But this could cause more problems because Iraq's sovereignty will be an issue. The government is weak, and there are many different groups fighting for control.

I talk about the war in Iraq.
It is not a real war because it was not declared by Congress.
I do not like the war.
It was not a big reason to bomb Iraq.
I think the United States did it to get back at Iraq for the attacks on September 11.
I do not follow the news about the war.
I think we stay in Iraq to build democracy and get oil.
But it is not a good reason.
Democracy cannot be built in one day.
If we leave, it takes time for Iraq to start again.
It is difficult to decide if the war should continue.
I think the war should not be called a war.
It is for showing we are big and American.
I think it is not very important to stay in Iraq.
It is important to help Iraq, but it is also a waste of resources.
I feel bad for President Bush.
The war makes him look bad.
The Vietnam War was like this.
It was not declared by Congress.
It is called a meaningless war.
Bush will be called a bad president because of the war.
There are many families with sons and daughters in Iraq.
I want the war to stay because of them.
But they have a different culture than us.
If we stay, it makes the situation worse.
Al-Qaeda will grow more.
Their hatred for the U.S. will grow.
It will hurt us in the end to keep staying there.
The war will go on for a long time.

I do not feel it is right to make it legal or for a state to declare it legal. The constitution says church and state should be separate. Trying to change that would be wrong. It would be like one church's beliefs over another. Most Catholics and Christians are against it. I think the government should not decide what churches can or cannot make illegal. Separation of church and state is important for religious tolerance in the United States. Making an amendment about it would be against the constitution. It would restrict people, not the government. The federal government should not be involved in this issue. The president's push for an amendment is just his personal belief as a Catholic. I think the churches should decide this. There is no good reason for an amendment. It might even help society.

The war in Iraq was a big mistake. The government did not tell the truth about the reasons for going to war. They said it was to stop terrorism, but it was really to take over Iraq. In 2003, the war started. Many people did not agree with the war, including me. I think it was like the Vietnam War. The government should have learned from that. Many soldiers died, and the government was not ready for what happened after. They took away Iraq's government and tried to put a new one in place, but it was very hard. Many people were against this. The war is still going on in 2006. Many soldiers are still dying. The government should have planned better. It was not an easy thing to do. I hope the war ends soon, but it probably won't.

I think I am for gay marriage. I always have been. I think it is a personal choice, and it is not something that should take away rights from anyone, because it is not under their control. I think it is not fair. I always have been an advocate for gay marriage.

I do not think politics or government should be involved in this. It is not a state issue. It is a personal issue. It is a household issue. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live like any other family. They walk the dogs and live like everyone else.

I think it is not right for President Bush to decide what marriage should be. I think it is silly.

I have heard and read that some people believe being gay is a chemical thing in the brain, something that you might be born with. This is different from growing up in a certain way.

I think marriage should be a private matter. If a man and woman want to get married, they can do it without anyone knowing. But if two gay people get married, it becomes public.

I do not think government should be involved in marriage. Marriage should be a personal decision.

When you put something on the internet, it is public. Everyone can see it. You cannot control this. It is good to remember this. As a Resident Assistant, I have dealt with this already. You put something out there, and it can affect people's opinions of you. If you talk about bad things, someone could say something. The internet is seen by everyone. If you are friends with someone on Myspace, you get their bulletins. Obviously, the school did not get the bulletin first. Someone went to the school. They had to act. They cannot let it sit, just in case something happens. They must prevent it. But sometimes, people only fool around. They do not mean what they say. In our school, something happened. Some people overheard something and called it in. When the school found out who the person was, they looked through his Facebook. They got worried because there were bad things there. He may have meant it as a joke. But now, it was serious. When you put stuff on the internet, there is no privacy. If you do not want it out there, you should not put it there. You cannot tell people what to think. You cannot tell them what to take seriously. School officials should not friend students on Myspace or Facebook. They should not stalk students' accounts. But if someone brings something to the school officials, there is no invasion of privacy. They must take it seriously. Teachers should not make accounts and friend students. This is not good. It is the same as stalking students. I should not friend my residents because I do not want to know what they do. I do not want to see pictures of them drinking. Then I have to do something about it. It is not my place. I do not want that connection.

The war has lasted too long. The original purpose was good – to bring democracy to a country without a fair political system. But now, the motivation seems unclear. We are not winning. We are not getting the results we want. We should stop the war and bring our soldiers home. We should use our money to help our own people, not fight a long and uncertain war. It is time to stop and think about what we are doing.

I want to ask a question.
Someone found information online about a situation and it prevented a bad thing from happening.
Is it okay for people to look at others' profiles on MySpace?
If you post information on the internet, other people can see it.
It's like giving permission to see your profile.
But it's not okay to have someone's job be to look at people's profiles.
It depends on the situation.
If someone finds evidence of bad things, it's okay.
But if someone just looks at profiles randomly, it's not okay.
I don't have MySpace, but I have Facebook.
I worry about creepy people seeing my information.
I've seen a TV show where a man got a girl's name and talked to her in a minute.
I have friends who IM me on Facebook.
I don't know them in real life.
They know my interests, photos, and class schedule.
It's hard because I want to communicate with friends.
I only accept people I know on Facebook.
But I don't know who can see my profile.

I feel bad talking about this. I feel like I'm joining others who say they were against the Iraq War from the start. But it's not important now. Most people think it was a bad idea. Eighty percent of Iraqis and U.S. troops think we should leave. It's been a disaster since we started. The administration doesn't want to admit they were wrong. I don't see a reason to stay. I don't understand why we should stay. It's hard to understand why the administration thinks we should stay. The culture and politics are very different in the Middle East. Saddam was a bad leader, but we didn't consider the consequences before we invaded. We should leave now. Iraqis want us to leave. It's better to leave now. We can't be the good guys in the Middle East. Staying is worse than leaving now.

I think there is still some gender discrimination in the United States. Both men and women experience this.
For example, it can be hard for a woman to get a high position in a company because of the "glass ceiling." People may think women are not as good as men.
Also, men who stay at home to take care of children often face problems. People might think it's not right for a man to do this. They might think he should be the main worker.
In the fashion industry, men might not be taken seriously because they are seen as not knowing about fashion for women.
This happens in other industries too. For example, a person from a farm might not get a good job if they don't speak or write well. Other people might think they are not really intelligent.
I think change is slow and we need to work at the right pace. People should not force the idea of equality. Instead, they can show good examples.
We should also be careful about judging others based on where they come from. This can cause discrimination.

I learned that they changed marijuana to a less serious crime. This made it like a traffic ticket, not a serious punishment. If someone gets a ticket, it does not hurt their job chances as much as a drug charge. But, the problem is that the worst effects can still happen. Many people worry about this. It also costs a lot to arrest and punish people who use it. This is why some cities do not change their laws. However, in places like Denver, where people are more open to new ideas, they did change the law. They now have more money for schools, social programs, and food for homeless people. It is important to legalize marijuana because it will save money and help people. But it should not be everywhere, because it is still against the law in many places. People may feel embarrassed if it is shown in public. I think alcohol has worse effects on driving skills. But marijuana can also affect people's lives. Everyone reacts differently to substances. So it is hard to make rules for everyone.

I say yes.
Many things they do are traditional.
Good to be rooted in tradition.
But also need to be adaptable to change.
Many Catholics go to church every week.
They follow rules closely.
Sometimes, they look down on others who don't follow perfectly.
They don't accept people of other religions.
My parents were an Episcopalian and a Catholic.
They wouldn't marry in the Catholic church.
This is not being tolerant of other religions.
They teach to love others, but don't accept them.
This is hypocritical.
Catholic teaching says to do things, but practice is outdated.
They continue to follow it.
I think priests should be allowed to marry.
But this would not stop pedophilic behavior.
It's a different situation.
I think it would not be an issue.
Pedophiles would act the same, with or without a spouse.
Allowing priests to marry would not prevent these things.
These problems would still happen.

I don't know.
I am not sure what to think.
This topic is very difficult.
It is so close to the issue of church and state.
And how to define marriage is hard to do without upsetting anyone.

So, I don't know.
Maybe all civil unions should be treated the same.
Maybe the government should not look at them in a special way because they are sacraments.
If two people get married, they should just get a civil union.
That's what it is.

If all states agree, then they should make it a federal law.
But changing the constitution to ban gay marriage is silly.
It is not big enough to change the constitution.
It is not important enough to amend the constitution.

No, I don't think the constitution should be changed for this.

I grew up in a Christian home.
I think of homosexuality as a difficult issue.
I have many gay friends.
I do not agree with their lifestyle.
But, I think it should be legal.
I do not think it should be a national issue.
I think each state should decide.
Many states are democratic.
Many states are republican.
Democratic states will support gay marriage.
If you live in a democratic state, you know its position.
I think you should not disagree if a state legalizes gay marriage.
I think homosexuals should have the same opportunities as others.
I think it should be legal based on each state's decision.
I do not think President Bush should decide for the whole country.
I think it should be up to the states.
I do not agree with his ban.
I think each state should decide how to run itself.
He will be out of office soon.
If a new president decides to lift the ban, it will change back and forth.
It should be up to each state.
They will live with the decision, not the president.

I think that students should not be worried about posting on Myspace. Myspace is public. That means everyone can see what you post. Even school officials can look at what students post. This is because students might say or do something that could be harmful to others. School officials should check online to find out if students are doing bad things. This helps keep students safe. However, it is not okay for school officials to look on the internet just to catch students. The internet should only be used to make the school safer. If school officials find something dangerous, they should stop it. This is their job. It is important to be safe in school.

War
First, I was very angry. I was affected by 9/11. I wanted to fight back. But now I am not so sure.

We went to war to fight the people who did this. But maybe we did not think enough about what might happen.

We did not have a good plan. We were not ready. We did not know what to expect.

I think it was too emotional. We were not thinking clearly. We wanted revenge. President Bush wanted to go to war. Everyone was angry.

But we could have done things better. We did not have a good plan. We did not know what to do.

We should have not gone in. They were fighting each other. They did not want us there.

We are not making enough progress. We are not helping them. They will fight again after we leave. We should leave.

transformed_texts:
The Catholic Church needs to change some of its views.
This is because the church is losing followers.
Many people do not agree with the church's strong opinions on gay marriage, abortion, and birth control.
The church has old-fashioned views on these subjects.
If the church changed to newer thinking, it might not lose followers.
Some people are turning against the church because of its views on these subjects.
They do not agree with the church on these issues.
The church is against abortion, so people who support it might not feel comfortable.
The church is also against gay marriage.
People who believe in it might not want to follow the church.
I do not see any reason why female priests are not allowed or why priests cannot be married.
But I do not know if this would have prevented the loss of followers.
The church might not have done things differently if priests could be married.
It is hard to know for sure.
I do not see why priests cannot have a family life, too.
The church says priests are married to God, but everyone else has a family life and other commitments.

Me, I am not against gay marriage. It does not matter if people are born this way or not. I think people should not be blamed for their sexual orientation. It is not something they choose. Some people say a man and a woman can marry, but not two people of the same sex. This is wrong. I do not think the federal government should decide this. It is not a legal or moral issue. It is not safe for our country. It is not right to judge people just because of their birth. They should not be punished.

I think that gay marriage should be legalized. There is not a good reason not to. Many people believe that homosexual couples threaten the traditional family, but it is different. There are many reasons why it should be legal. In some places, gay couples cannot visit their partners in the hospital or stay together in the same home. This is not fair. Many studies show that gay couples have the same kind of relationships as straight couples. They want a marriage certificate, not a church wedding. If religions do not want to perform the ceremony, that is their choice. They should not prevent the government from giving a marriage certificate because it is a legal document, not a religious one. Gay couples can adopt children and be good parents, just like straight couples. The community will not be harmed by them. The federal government should make it legal in every state. It is unfair to ban gay marriage if the government cannot even agree on issues like prayer in schools. Many people think that gay people are damaged or traumatized, but this is not true. Scientists have studied this and found that it is not correct. People should listen to scientists instead of just their friends and neighbors.

I work in a hospital pharmacy this summer. I say no to having illegal drugs available to the public. But for medical use, I say yes. Illegal drugs can be good because some are used in medicines.

For example, oxycotton, Vicodin, and Percocets are controlled substances, but we use them. We should not deny their benefits just because they are taboo. We should embrace their benefits.

Marijuana is different from alcohol. Abusing either can cause bad things, but marijuana is not as bad as heroine or cocaine. People have a bad image of marijuana because it's an illegal drug. If we remove this bad image, people might use it responsibly for medical purposes.

I think we should make marijuana legal gradually, not all at once. This way, people can use it responsibly. It is not a simple issue.

I think the church has changed to be more modern.
Before, it was stricter. When I was young, I went to church every Sunday. I wore a cute dress, matching shoes, and a purse. Now, the church has a teenager mass that is short, thirty minutes. People wear more casual clothes, even at morning masses. I think other changes include family arriving late and dressing casually.
 Concerning the accusations against Catholic priests, I do not think the church could have prevented the abuse. Some men become pedophiles even if they are married. It is not because they are allowed or not allowed to get married. In other religions, like Seventh Heaven, men can get married, but I think those who want to practice their faith and be married should choose a different faith. I think pedophilia is often genetic, not something people are brought up to be. The church might not have known about all cases, but if they did and covered it up, they should be ashamed.

I was fine with the idea but many people were still upset about the September 11 attacks.
The Bush administration said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction and was connected to Osama Bin Laden. This was not true.
I think the Bush administration lied to the American people. Colin Powell, who was Secretary of State, said later he was not sure about the evidence he presented at the UN.
I think this is a problem. The Bush administration did not follow the constitution and tried to change it. They wanted to go to war because of their feelings about Saddam Hussein and to get more energy.
The war has lasted too long. But if we leave now, Iraq could have a civil war. The UN and US want to get help from nearby countries like Syria and Saudi Arabia. But this could cause more problems because Iraq's sovereignty will be an issue. The government is weak, and there are many different groups fighting for control.

I talk about the war in Iraq.
It is not a real war because it was not declared by Congress.
I do not like the war.
It was not a big reason to bomb Iraq.
I think the United States did it to get back at Iraq for the attacks on September 11.
I do not follow the news about the war.
I think we stay in Iraq to build democracy and get oil.
But it is not a good reason.
Democracy cannot be built in one day.
If we leave, it takes time for Iraq to start again.
It is difficult to decide if the war should continue.
I think the war should not be called a war.
It is for showing we are big and American.
I think it is not very important to stay in Iraq.
It is important to help Iraq, but it is also a waste of resources.
I feel bad for President Bush.
The war makes him look bad.
The Vietnam War was like this.
It was not declared by Congress.
It is called a meaningless war.
Bush will be called a bad president because of the war.
There are many families with sons and daughters in Iraq.
I want the war to stay because of them.
But they have a different culture than us.
If we stay, it makes the situation worse.
Al-Qaeda will grow more.
Their hatred for the U.S. will grow.
It will hurt us in the end to keep staying there.
The war will go on for a long time.

I do not feel it is right to make it legal or for a state to declare it legal. The constitution says church and state should be separate. Trying to change that would be wrong. It would be like one church's beliefs over another. Most Catholics and Christians are against it. I think the government should not decide what churches can or cannot make illegal. Separation of church and state is important for religious tolerance in the United States. Making an amendment about it would be against the constitution. It would restrict people, not the government. The federal government should not be involved in this issue. The president's push for an amendment is just his personal belief as a Catholic. I think the churches should decide this. There is no good reason for an amendment. It might even help society.

The war in Iraq was a big mistake. The government did not tell the truth about the reasons for going to war. They said it was to stop terrorism, but it was really to take over Iraq. In 2003, the war started. Many people did not agree with the war, including me. I think it was like the Vietnam War. The government should have learned from that. Many soldiers died, and the government was not ready for what happened after. They took away Iraq's government and tried to put a new one in place, but it was very hard. Many people were against this. The war is still going on in 2006. Many soldiers are still dying. The government should have planned better. It was not an easy thing to do. I hope the war ends soon, but it probably won't.

I think I am for gay marriage. I always have been. I think it is a personal choice, and it is not something that should take away rights from anyone, because it is not under their control. I think it is not fair. I always have been an advocate for gay marriage.

I do not think politics or government should be involved in this. It is not a state issue. It is a personal issue. It is a household issue. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live like any other family. They walk the dogs and live like everyone else.

I think it is not right for President Bush to decide what marriage should be. I think it is silly.

I have heard and read that some people believe being gay is a chemical thing in the brain, something that you might be born with. This is different from growing up in a certain way.

I think marriage should be a private matter. If a man and woman want to get married, they can do it without anyone knowing. But if two gay people get married, it becomes public.

I do not think government should be involved in marriage. Marriage should be a personal decision.

When you put something on the internet, it is public. Everyone can see it. You cannot control this. It is good to remember this. As a Resident Assistant, I have dealt with this already. You put something out there, and it can affect people's opinions of you. If you talk about bad things, someone could say something. The internet is seen by everyone. If you are friends with someone on Myspace, you get their bulletins. Obviously, the school did not get the bulletin first. Someone went to the school. They had to act. They cannot let it sit, just in case something happens. They must prevent it. But sometimes, people only fool around. They do not mean what they say. In our school, something happened. Some people overheard something and called it in. When the school found out who the person was, they looked through his Facebook. They got worried because there were bad things there. He may have meant it as a joke. But now, it was serious. When you put stuff on the internet, there is no privacy. If you do not want it out there, you should not put it there. You cannot tell people what to think. You cannot tell them what to take seriously. School officials should not friend students on Myspace or Facebook. They should not stalk students' accounts. But if someone brings something to the school officials, there is no invasion of privacy. They must take it seriously. Teachers should not make accounts and friend students. This is not good. It is the same as stalking students. I should not friend my residents because I do not want to know what they do. I do not want to see pictures of them drinking. Then I have to do something about it. It is not my place. I do not want that connection.

The war has lasted too long. The original purpose was good – to bring democracy to a country without a fair political system. But now, the motivation seems unclear. We are not winning. We are not getting the results we want. We should stop the war and bring our soldiers home. We should use our money to help our own people, not fight a long and uncertain war. It is time to stop and think about what we are doing.

I want to ask a question.
Someone found information online about a situation and it prevented a bad thing from happening.
Is it okay for people to look at others' profiles on MySpace?
If you post information on the internet, other people can see it.
It's like giving permission to see your profile.
But it's not okay to have someone's job be to look at people's profiles.
It depends on the situation.
If someone finds evidence of bad things, it's okay.
But if someone just looks at profiles randomly, it's not okay.
I don't have MySpace, but I have Facebook.
I worry about creepy people seeing my information.
I've seen a TV show where a man got a girl's name and talked to her in a minute.
I have friends who IM me on Facebook.
I don't know them in real life.
They know my interests, photos, and class schedule.
It's hard because I want to communicate with friends.
I only accept people I know on Facebook.
But I don't know who can see my profile.

I feel bad talking about this. I feel like I'm joining others who say they were against the Iraq War from the start. But it's not important now. Most people think it was a bad idea. Eighty percent of Iraqis and U.S. troops think we should leave. It's been a disaster since we started. The administration doesn't want to admit they were wrong. I don't see a reason to stay. I don't understand why we should stay. It's hard to understand why the administration thinks we should stay. The culture and politics are very different in the Middle East. Saddam was a bad leader, but we didn't consider the consequences before we invaded. We should leave now. Iraqis want us to leave. It's better to leave now. We can't be the good guys in the Middle East. Staying is worse than leaving now.

I think there is still some gender discrimination in the United States. Both men and women experience this.
For example, it can be hard for a woman to get a high position in a company because of the "glass ceiling." People may think women are not as good as men.
Also, men who stay at home to take care of children often face problems. People might think it's not right for a man to do this. They might think he should be the main worker.
In the fashion industry, men might not be taken seriously because they are seen as not knowing about fashion for women.
This happens in other industries too. For example, a person from a farm might not get a good job if they don't speak or write well. Other people might think they are not really intelligent.
I think change is slow and we need to work at the right pace. People should not force the idea of equality. Instead, they can show good examples.
We should also be careful about judging others based on where they come from. This can cause discrimination.

I learned that they changed marijuana to a less serious crime. This made it like a traffic ticket, not a serious punishment. If someone gets a ticket, it does not hurt their job chances as much as a drug charge. But, the problem is that the worst effects can still happen. Many people worry about this. It also costs a lot to arrest and punish people who use it. This is why some cities do not change their laws. However, in places like Denver, where people are more open to new ideas, they did change the law. They now have more money for schools, social programs, and food for homeless people. It is important to legalize marijuana because it will save money and help people. But it should not be everywhere, because it is still against the law in many places. People may feel embarrassed if it is shown in public. I think alcohol has worse effects on driving skills. But marijuana can also affect people's lives. Everyone reacts differently to substances. So it is hard to make rules for everyone.

I think that students should not be worried about posting on Myspace. Myspace is public. That means everyone can see what you post. Even school officials can look at what students post. This is because students might say or do something that could be harmful to others. School officials should check online to find out if students are doing bad things. This helps keep students safe. However, it is not okay for school officials to look on the internet just to catch students. The internet should only be used to make the school safer. If school officials find something dangerous, they should stop it. This is their job. It is important to be safe in school.

War
First, I was very angry. I was affected by 9/11. I wanted to fight back. But now I am not so sure.

We went to war to fight the people who did this. But maybe we did not think enough about what might happen.

We did not have a good plan. We were not ready. We did not know what to expect.

I think it was too emotional. We were not thinking clearly. We wanted revenge. President Bush wanted to go to war. Everyone was angry.

But we could have done things better. We did not have a good plan. We did not know what to do.

We should have not gone in. They were fighting each other. They did not want us there.

We are not making enough progress. We are not helping them. They will fight again after we leave. We should leave.
